summary: Venture through the Winter storms of the north to discover a new home located just outside of Winterhold.
descriptionHtml:
[b][u][i][size=4]What Does This Mod Add?[/size][/i][/u][/b]
[i]The Mammoth's Tusk[/i] is a small house mod that adds a play home near the College of Winterhold.  Did you ever find it weird that there was no home near the college that wasn't owned by any college students, who are presently in the college... Well I did, so that's were this mod comes in.  The new player home, [i]The Mammoth's Tusk, [/i]is a small home which has a main focus for any Mage character. 

[size=4][b][u][i]Where Is It Located?
[/i][/u][/b] [i][size=2]The[/size][/i][size=3][size=2][i]Mammoth's Tusk [/i]is located near the city of Winterhold.  Upon entering the city, you can turn right and travel towards the cliff edge.  A map marker will appear when you discover the home(Check out the screenshots, if location is unsure).

[/size][/size][/size][size=4][b][i][u]Who Is This Mod Directed Towards?
[/u][/i][/b][size=2]The mod is was originally created for any mage who wants to go to the College of Winterhold, however this can be used by any character of your choice. 

[size=4][b][i][u]What Else Is In The Mod?
[/u][/i][/b][size=2]The mod adds a new NPC, named Syris, who used to live in [i]The Mammoth's Tusk[/i] until he met his unfortunate end.  He will appear as a ghost near the his old home, as a reminder to any passerby that magic isn't anything that should be taken lightly.  You can read through Syris' old journal and discover his story and what truly happened to him.  There is a new spell tone, can you guess what it adds?
[/size][/size][/size][/size]
[size=4][i][u][b]How Do I Install It?
[/b][/u][/i][size=2][b]First things first, I'd highly recommend you use Mod Organizer. 
If not, here's how... install the files to your Skyrim/data folder... and that's it

[/b][size=4][b][i][u]How Do I Uninstall It?
[/u][/i][/b] [size=2]If you need to uninstall the file, just remove anything you added to the Skyrim/data folder.  If you don't know what the file(s) are just reinstall the file and use that as a reference.
[/size]
[b][i][u]I Like You Mod, But Can I Change It?  What Permission Are You Giving Me?
[/u][/i][/b][size=2]Of course you can edit the mod all you want.  I am giving you permission to change and edit the mod, however I do not give you permission to re-upload my file to any other sites.  If you edit the file and upload your own file to a site, then please give me credit and leave a link to this site.

[/size][/size][/size][/size][size=4][b][i][u]Suggested Mods
[/u][/i][/b][size=2]I'd recommend using Real Shelter([url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52612/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52612/[/url]?) to prevent snow from going through the walls.

[/size][/size][size=4][b][i][u]Known Issues[/u][/i][/b]
[size=2]Supreme Storms made the house act like it had no walls at all. [/size]

[/size]
author: BountyBeme
